translator.Printer
Class CodePrinter

java.lang.Object
  xtc.tree.Utility
      xtc.tree.Printer

public class CodePrinter
extends xtc.tree.Printer

Responsible for printing out pretty code.

Field Detail

systemOutWriter

private static java.io.OutputStreamWriter systemOutWriter
Java doesn't like it when two things share System.out for stream writing, or something like that (only one stream was printing), so use a static guy to share it if the file can't be found.

filePath

private java.lang.String filePath
The full path to the file, including the name.

fileName

private java.lang.String fileName
The name of the file we are writing to.

before

private CodeBlock before
A code block that is dumped before everything else.

blocks

private java.util.Hashtable<PrintOrder,java.util.ArrayList<CodeBlock>> blocks
The list of all the blocks that still need to be printed here. We must cache them so that we can get their orders right for printing -> the prototypes, headers, and includes need to come in a specific order in the file, so we can't just allow the blocks to print out as they come in. This blows.

Constructor Detail

CodePrinter

private CodePrinter(java.io.Writer w,
                    java.lang.String fileName)
This is not too important, because we're extending printer, but only allow construct from the factory method.

dump

private void dump()
We're done, so get everything dumped to a file.

factory

public static CodePrinter factory(java.lang.String ext)
Sets up our printer. Attempts to get a file writer on outputFile, and if it fails, then it just defaults to writing to stdout. If it succeeds, then the file is destroyed and all the output goes into that file.

Parameters:
ext - The ext that the file being written should have. Typically, this will be "h" or "cpp".
